key_points: Kyle Rittenhouse was acquitted of all charges related to the August 2020 shootings of three men in Kenosha, Wisconsin.
Rep. Cori Bush (D-MO) and other Democrats expressed outrage, attributing the verdict to white supremacy.
New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio repeated the incorrect claim that Rittenhouse crossed state lines with a weapon.
Rep. Jerry Nadler (D-NY) and Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) criticized the verdict and called for a federal review.
President Joe Biden expressed his respect for the jury system and its conclusion.
Celebrities in Hollywood and activists expressed dismay and criticized the judicial system following the verdict.
Kenosha County Circuit Judge Bruce Schroeder and the jury faced criticism from various public figures.
The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) criticized police for enabling white supremacist militia members.
The prosecution did not label Rittenhouse as a 'white supremacist' in their closing arguments.
Rittenhouse's spokesperson David Hancock criticized Joe Biden for previously calling Rittenhouse a 'white supremacist'.
spokespersons: Bill de Blasio (Mayor, New York City)
Rep. Jerry Nadler (D-NY, Chairman of the House Judiciary Committee)
President Joe Biden (President of the United States)
